lines.gurmukhi: bwjq nIswn sunIAq chUM Er jYsy audq pRDwn Bwn durY n durwey sY
lines.transliteration_english: Baajat Neesaan Souneeat Chahoon Aor Jaisay , Udat Pradhaan Bhaan Durai N Duraaay Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the beat of the drum is heard on all four sides (its sound cannot be hidden) and when the supreme celestial body-sun rises, its light cannot be concealed;

lines.gurmukhi: dIpk sY dwvw Bey skl sMswru jwnY Gtkw mY isMD jYsy iCpY n iCpwey sY
lines.transliteration_english: Deepak Sai Daavaa Bhaay Sakal Sansaaru Jaanai , Ghatakaa Mai Sindh Jaisay Chhipai N Chhipaaay Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the whole world knows that light emanates from a lamp, and the ocean cannot be contained in a small earthenware pitcher;

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ckvY n Cwno rhq isMGwsn sY dys mY duhweI Pyry imty n imtwey sY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Chakavai N Chhaano Rahat Singhaasan Sai , Days Mai Duhaaee Dhayray Mitay N Mitaaay Sai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an emperor sitting on the throne of his mighty empire cannot remain hidden; he is known among the subjects of his kingdom and that glory and fame is hard to destroy;

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gurmuiK piRA pRym ko pRgwsu jwsu gupqu n rhY moin biRq aupjwey sY ]411]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gurmukhi Pria Praym Ko Pragaasu Jaasu , Goupatu N Rahai Moni Brit Oupajaaay Sai ?411?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the Guru-oriented Sikh whose heart is enlightened by the love of the Lord and His meditation, cannot remain hidden. His silence gives him away.  (411)
